Package dev.todoapp.infrastructure

Class JumpHost

java.lang.Object
software.amazon.jsii.JsiiObject
software.constructs.Construct
dev.todoapp.infrastructure.JumpHost
All Implemented Interfaces:
software.amazon.jsii.JsiiSerializable, software.constructs.IConstruct, software.constructs.IDependable
public class JumpHost extends software.constructs.Construct
A stack that deploys an EC2 instance to use as a jump host (or "bastion host") to create an SSH tunnel to the RDS instance. The jump host is placed into the public subnets of a given VPC and it will have access the database's security group.

The following parameters need to exist in the SSM parameter store for this stack to successfully deploy:

  • <environmentName>-Network-vpcId: ID of the VPC to deploy the database into.
  • <environmentName>-Network-publicSubnetIdOne: ID of the first public subnet in which to deploy this jump host.
  • <environmentName>-Network-publicSubnetIdTwo: ID of the second public subnet in which to deploy this jump host.
  • <environmentName>-<applicationName>-Database-securityGroupId: ID of the database's security group

The stack creates its public IP address as output, so you can look up its IP address in the CloudFormation AWS console when you need it to access it via SSH.
